members.joinCircumstances: Fisher Tiger founded the Sun Pirates after freeing the slaves from Mary Geoise to protect the freed slaves and give them a home.

keyMoments.title: Sun Pirates Formation Revealed
keyMoments.description: Hancock reveals that after Fisher Tiger freed the slaves from Mary Geoise, the freed fish-men slaves decided to join him and he formed the Sun Pirates. He created their sun symbol to cover the slave brands of the Hoof of the Celestial Dragon.
keyMoments.significance: The formation of the Sun Pirates represents hope and freedom for former slaves. The sun symbol covering the slave brands is a powerful statement of transformation from property to free people.

keyMoments.title: Sun Pirates Symbol Explained
keyMoments.description: The meaning of the Sun Pirates' sun mark is revealed - it was created by Fisher Tiger to brand over the Hoof of the Celestial Dragon slave marks, giving freed slaves a new identity and hiding their shameful past.
keyMoments.significance: This explains why characters like Hatchan and Arlong bear the sun mark and connects multiple arcs. The symbol represents the transformation from slavery to freedom.

jollyRoger.description: A sun symbol with a smiling face, designed to cover the Hoof of the Celestial Dragon slave brand
jollyRoger.significance: The sun jolly roger serves dual purposes: as the crew's symbol and as a way to rebrand former slaves, covering their shameful marks with a symbol of freedom and new life

crewPhilosophy: Liberation and freedom for all, regardless of race. Fisher Tiger founded the crew on the principle of not discriminating between species, freeing both fish-men and humans from slavery despite his own hatred of humans.

disbandmentStatus.reason: The crew split after Fisher Tiger's death, with some members joining Arlong and others following Jinbe

keyMoments.title: Hancock's First Voyage with the Kuja Pirates
keyMoments.description: It is revealed that Hancock, Sandersonia, and Marigold were on their first voyage as trainee pirates with the Kuja Pirates when they were kidnapped by slave traders at age twelve.
keyMoments.significance: This backstory explains how the Boa sisters were captured and provides context for their tragic past. Their first adventure as pirates ended in their worst nightmare.

jollyRoger.description: A skull with a crown and snake design, representing the Pirate Empress and the snake-themed warrior women of Amazon Lily

crewPhilosophy: An all-female pirate crew from Amazon Lily, led by the Pirate Empress Boa Hancock who is also a Warlord of the Sea.
